channel.title: The Honorable Brian Sandoval
channel.description: The Honorable Brian Sandoval Governor of Nevada (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Thank you.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: I stand here tonight humbled to share with you the story of a nation, a state and of one man.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: It is the story of America itself ­ of courageous, freedom-loving visionaries who believed in the promise of opportunity, rather than the divine right of kings.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: Who dared to dream that anyone could rise above the circumstances of their birth.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: It is also the story of the great Silver State: Battle Born Nevada!
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: We joined the Union to help keep Abraham Lincoln in the White House and fulfill the promise of opportunity, as he ended forever the scourge of slavery.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: And, it is my story: the child of working-class Hispanic Americans who has lived the American dream.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: The Proverbs tell us "from small beginnings come great things." My father was one of ten children. My mother and her family lived in a tiny, two-bedroom house in the Southwest.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: Dad worked his entire career as an aviation technician. Mom was a legal secretary who became a teacher. We lived a simple American life.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: When I was a boy, my parents brought us to Nevada in search of opportunity. My first job was cleaning sheep pens. In college, I worked in a hospital cafeteria. I worked my way through law school.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: Encouraged by my parents' love for this country, I dreamed of public service. I became a state legislator, a gaming regulator, and attorney general of my state.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: My story could end there, but this is America. And so, in 2005, a simple son of promise was appointed by President Bush, and confirmed by the United States Senate as a federal judge.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: I saw in my courtroom the fulfillment of all that our forefathers sought to create. A nation of laws. A nation of due process and merit and justice for all.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: And, yes, a nation of immigrants.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: One of the greatest duties I performed was to administer the oath of citizenship to new Americans ­ immigrants who embody our dream of opportunity and prosperity. But from the federal bench, I also saw a nation beset on all sides by unprecedented challenges.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: I watched my state's economy falter, stagnate and slide into decline. Nevadans lost their jobs and their homes.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: Nevada was hit hardest by the recession ­ highest unemployment, highest foreclosure rate, highest bankruptcy rate.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: Like so many, I looked around for help. And what did I find?
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: A president who promised change, but turned instead to the same tired strategy of ever-larger government. A president who abandoned hope and embraced only blame.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: So I stepped down from a lifetime appointment to make a difference. I ran for governor, was elected and, like Republican governors all across this nation, I chose to make the tough decisions:
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: On issues like economic development, education reform and redesigning how state government operates.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: On job creation, and reducing state spending, and eliminating red tape. It hasn't been easy. And we're not through it yet.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: But I have put my faith in the people of my great state ­ because they are the ones who will grow our economy.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: I have seen Hispanic business owners and families from backgrounds -- not unlike my own -- struggle in this economy.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: I have seen young children from all walks of life begin to wonder if their future holds any hope at all.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: Make no mistake: The current administration's failed experiment with big government gets in the way of economic recovery. Their love affair with government regulation is a drag on business confidence.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: From personal experience, I can tell you what will help states like Nevada and families like mine: elect the team that understands how to get America working again. Send Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan to the White House!
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: This administration sings the siren song that this is all there is. They tell us government is the answer, but we know it's the problem.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: They tell us we didn't build our businesses, but somebody else made it happen. They tell us not to dream but to settle.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: You and I know America is better than that.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: Our national story is one of confronting challenges ­ and winning. We have overcome economic devastation, defeated mighty oppressors and lifted up generation after generation of Americans.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: We can ­ and we will ­ do it again.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: For that is our birthright as members of the American family ­ white, black, Hispanic, Asian, immigrant or descendent of the Founding Fathers themselves.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: We must leave Tampa this week on a mission to remind Americans they deserve more than the status quo. They deserve to dream big.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: We must remind Americans that the promise of opportunity remains unbroken ­ that every person in this great nation can succeed through hard work, courage and personal responsibility.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: For that is the real American story.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: Thank you.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval

item.title: And now, let me introduce to you one of those Hispanic business owners that I mentioned are struggling in this economy, Mr. Phil Archuletta of New Mexico.
item.author: The Honorable Brian Sandoval
